parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>The post does not contain a CMF number.  While the absence of a CMF number doesn't automatically disqualify it as propaganda, it's a factor to consider.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>The post explicitly mentions Elena Lasconi as a candidate for Cotroceni (presidency, not parliamentary elections). It also mentions Mihail Neamțu and Samuel Zărnescu as alternative candidates for the Chamber of Deputies.  This directly refers to candidates, fulfilling Article 36 (7) - a.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>The post is a paid Facebook advertisement, inherently targeting a wide audience. The language used ("votul meu și al vostru") further suggests an appeal to a broad public, satisfying Article 36 (7) - c.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>The primary objective of the post is to dissuade voters from supporting Elena Lasconi and encourage them to consider alternative candidates (Neamțu and Zărnescu).  The strong negative framing of Lasconi and the explicit recommendation of alternatives clearly aim to influence voting behavior, fulfilling Article 36 (7) - c. The post uses emotionally charged language ("coșmar," "vrăjmaș," "pericol iminent") to achieve this objective.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>The post presents opinions and arguments, but it lacks the objectivity and neutrality expected of journalistic reporting.  The strong bias against Lasconi and the promotional nature of the message disqualify it as journalism. The provided link is to an article, but the post itself is not journalistic in nature.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>While the post expresses a strong personal opinion, it goes beyond simply stating an opinion. It actively advocates against a specific candidate and promotes others, making it electoral propaganda rather than a mere expression of personal views.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>889601543286900</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The post fulfills all criteria for electoral propaganda as defined by Article 36 (7) of LEGE nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006. It refers to specific candidates (Elena Lasconi, Mihail Neamțu, Samuel Zărnescu), targets a wide audience through a paid Facebook advertisement, and has the clear objective of influencing voters' choices.  The strong negative framing of Lasconi and the positive portrayal of the alternative candidates leave no doubt about its intention to sway public opinion.  While the post does not directly target the parliamentary elections, its influence on the presidential election is undeniable.  The timing of the post is also relevant; if it was posted after the official end of the electoral campaign period, it would be a clear violation of Article 98 t).
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate><name>Elena Lasconi</name><impact>NEGATIVE</impact></candidate>
  <candidate><name>Mihail Neamțu</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
  <candidate><name>Samuel Zărnescu</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>INDEPENDENT</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
Peter Costea, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea unei postări pe Facebook (ID: 889601543286900) după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, care conține propagandă electorală negativă împotriva Elenei Lasconi, candidată la președinție, și propagandă pozitivă pentru Mihail Neamțu și Samuel Zărnescu, candidați la Camera Deputaților. Postarea, având un caracter persuasiv evident prin folosirea unor termeni precum „coșmar”, „vrăjmaș”, „pericol iminent”, are ca efect electoral influențarea votului alegătorilor, îndemnându-i să nu voteze pentru Elena Lasconi și să opteze pentru candidații propuși.  Această acțiune constituie o încălcare clară a legii, deoarece postarea îndeplinește toate criteriile materialului de propagandă electorală, fiind adresată publicului larg și având un obiectiv electoral direct.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
